intro: Echium stenosiphon subsp. glabrescens, commonly known as the narrow-lobed thornweed, is a member of the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and narrow, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces striking blue to violet flowers in spikes, which bloom during the summer months. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
